thread.title: Hootsuite's CEO Tweeted A Sex Hotline Phone Number At A Reporter - BuzzFeed News
thread.title_full: Hootsuite's CEO Tweeted A Sex Hotline Phone Number At A Reporter - BuzzFeed News

author: Caroline O'Donovan
title: Hootsuite's CEO Tweeted A Sex Hotline Phone Number At A Reporter - BuzzFeed News
text:
View this image ›
ID: 10614914 The thing is, that’s not Holmes’ phone number — it’s the number for a paid sex hotline — 1-800-EAT-DICK . When you call it, a man’s voice offers you unpublishable favors, if you simply enter a valid Visa, Mastercard or American Express credit card number.
After BuzzFeed News reached out to Holmes and his PR team, he deleted the tweet, and his PR person pointed to a followup tweet sent by Holmes that says, “apologies. wrong number.”
@GerritD apologies. Wrong number.
— Ryan Holmes (@invoker) ID: 10614636 The timing of Holmes’ tweet is particularly ill-timed, considering the tech industry writ large is under fire this week for reports of pernicious sexism in the workplace. Earlier this month, a former Uber employee published a harrowing account of her time at the company, which detailed numerous allegations of sexual harassment and discrimination. The post sparked a public dialogue about how and why inappropriate behavior gets brushed under the rug at startups.
The reporter involved in the exchange declined to comment, but in an email, a Bloomberg spokesperson told BuzzFeed News that “we stand by our reporting.”
